Sprint 1.goal: Develop a basic temperature converter application functionality.

tasks.task_description: Create the main structure for the console-based temperature converter in a single Python file named `converter.py`. Include necessary imports and a basic program loop that will later handle user input and conversions.
tasks.task_name: Set up primary structure for the console-based application

tasks.task_description: Develop a reusable function `convert(value, from_unit, to_unit)` that performs temperature conversions between Celsius, Fahrenheit, and Kelvin. Ensure the logic is accurate and covers all possible conversions.
Write code to accept numeric value and unit inputs from the user. Validate these inputs to ensure numerical correctness and valid unit selection (Celsius, Fahrenheit, or Kelvin).

Sprint 2.goal: Finalize the temperature converter application with user interaction and display.

tasks.task_description: Review the code for readability, efficiency, and cleanliness. Make necessary refactoring for clear and understandable code structure.
tasks.task_name: Refactor and clean up the code

tasks.task_description: Thoroughly test the application for various scenarios including edge cases and invalid inputs. Debug any issues to ensure the application runs smoothly without errors.
tasks.task_name: Test and debug the entire application

tasks.task_description: Connect the temperature conversion function with user inputs. Display the converted results clearly in the terminal, showing the temperature in all three units (Celsius, Fahrenheit, Kelvin).
